attributes.action: introduce a shooting close season for the brown hare from February to September inclusive.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The brown hare is the only game species which does not have a shooting close season. This means hares are shot throughout their breeding season, resulting in thousands of orphaned leverets dying of starvation.

The brown hare's national population has declined by over 80% during the past century.  In the mid-1990s the Government's Biodiversity Steering Group identified a close season as an important conservation measure, but this has never been acted upon.

Our campaign for a close season does not imply we approve of hare shooting at other times of the year.  We simply see a close season as a realistic objective and a minimum requirement for the welfare and conservation of hares.
We remain firmly opposed to shooting hares for "sport" at all times.

Rodney Hale
Chairman - British Brown Hare Preservation Society
For and on behalf of the members of the BBHPS
